metadata.feature_description: Calculate and display user's rank based on reputation points

test_scenarios.scenario_name: View user rank based on reputation points

steps.action: Navigate to Admin > Users and click User Activity icon for Test User12
steps.expected: Activity tab opens showing rank calculated from reputation points
steps.actual: Activity tab opened successfully displaying Rank: 2, Reputation: 15, Experience: 20. The rank is prominently displayed alongside other metrics including Engagement, Influence, and Total Contributions.

steps.action: Click User Activity icon for Test User11 to verify rank varies by user
steps.expected: Different user shows different rank based on their reputation points
steps.actual: Test User11 shows Rank: 5 with Reputation: 5 and Experience: 5. This confirms the rank calculation is working correctly - users with higher reputation (Test User12: 15) have better ranks (2) than users with lower reputation (Test User11: 5) who have worse ranks (5).

observations: The rank is displayed in the Activity Tab as part of the user metrics section alongside Reputation, Experience, Engagement, Influence, and Total Contributions.
Rank calculation appears to be based on reputation points - users with higher reputation get better (lower) rank numbers.
The rank feature is visible for regular users on this Evoq Engage (Social) trial installation, confirming it displays for DNNSOCIAL SKU as documented.
Test User12 (Reputation: 15) has Rank 2, while Test User11 (Reputation: 5) has Rank 5, demonstrating proper rank ordering.
The Edit Points feature is available to modify reputation/experience points, which would affect rank calculation.
